INTERACTION_NOTE._text: ppGpp binds RNA polymerase (RNAP) near the catalytic center in the secondary channel |CITS:[15109491]|. Its binding is proposed to be stabilized by DskA. If the demand for rRNA is low, transcription can be inhibited by high levels of ppGpp or low levels of NTPs. RNAP is a direct target of ppGpp action. There are three proposed mechanisms through which ppGpp binding inhibits rRNA transcription: 1) ppGpp binds with the initiating NTP for the active site, 2) ppGpp pairs with a cytosine residue(s) just upstream of the transcription start site, 3) ppGpp decreases the lifetime of the open complex formed at all rRNA promoters |CITS:[15109491]|.
